Message.Msg: that is absurd. Freedom of speech may have suffered a recent kick in the groin, but it's the hysteria about it all that is what is taking our wild imaginations to task. Big Brother may be stalking us, but the real boogie man is the voice in our heads, the fear and loathing that the government can be like it was during the McCarthey era No it's not filming you at home or in the bedroom, but just the idea that they have supercomputers that are really interested in everyone's communications and contacts and their bias etc, can be scary enough. If you are Not an extremist or a threat to society, then just get a grip and realize that this whole thing became 'new' news right about the time after the Boston Marathon terror, that was implemented by a few narcissisistic home grown Chech lunatics. Hey Mr Obama, remember what you promised us and don't give us anymore lies or doubletalk. You still are the leader of the ' free' world. Be honest and transparent. Please don't be a puppet of power. Thank you. Fear makes you do things that are unbecoming of a leader.

Message.Title: Analyst Olstein on CNBC says Amazon "might be a buy at $50"--very little "free cash flow"
Message.Msg: May the reason for the decline today. Olstein values stocks based on free cash flow. He calls it the "oxygen" that drives stocks. He said that Amazon's low free cash flow in relation to its stock price is a classic warning, and he would sell.

Topic.Title: Analyst Olstein on CNBC says Amazon "might be a buy at $50"--very little "free cash flow"

Message.Msg: that is what Peter Lynch always said, but that is not why it is down today. It is down due to MOnday nights e-sales release by channel advisor - terrible sales news for AMZN, and it will see a multi-day decline due to that. Couple that will broad market weakness and there you go. The Cash Flow story has been there the whole time - this is nothing new - been ignored due to lie of "investments" being made (whern it is straight opex growth to support base business and growth). When the stock does finally start to drop, analysts will use all kinds of "new" assesments of their financial performance, like lack of earnings, cash flow and margins .... just like all other bubble stocks.
